thread.title: Garmin shares drop on disappointing outlook
thread.title_full: Garmin shares drop on disappointing outlook - MarketWatch

author: By     Tess Stynes
title: Garmin shares drop on disappointing outlook
text:
Garmin Ltd. issued disappointing per-share earnings guidance for the second quarter and cut its profit forecast for the year amid currency pressures and increased promotions and advertising spending in its fitness segment.
For the current quarter, the company forecast per-share earnings of 70 cents to 72 cents and revenue of $770 million to $775 million. Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters expected per-share profit of 89 cents and revenue of $773 million.
Garmin GRMN, -9.05% said foreign-exchange movements cut quarterly revenue by $55 million to $60 million, while a more promotional environment weighed on its fitness segment sales. While fitness segment sales growth slowed in the second quarter, the company’s sales momentum will improve in the second half of the year as its introduces new products and the company’s increased advertising spending helps spur sales.
For the year, the company lowered its per-share earnings, excluding items, estimate to $2.65, from its previous estimate for per-share profit of $3.10. Garmin affirmed its revenue estimate of roughly $2.9 billion.
An expanded version of this report appears at WSJ.com.
